segment.source: You can use the Windows Dev Center dashboard to run experiments for your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps with A/B testing.
segment.target: You can use the Windows Dev Center dashboard to run experiments for your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps with A/B testing.

segment.source: Run app experiments with A/B testing
segment.target: Run app experiments with A/B testing

segment.source: Run app experiments with A/B testing
segment.target: Run app experiments with A/B testing

segment.source: You can use the Windows Dev Center dashboard to run experiments for your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps with A/B testing.
segment.target: You can use the Windows Dev Center dashboard to run experiments for your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps with A/B testing.

segment.source: In an A/B test, you experiment with program variable assignments in your apps through Dev Center.
segment.target: In an A/B test, you experiment with program variable assignments in your apps through Dev Center.

segment.source: By building app logic around A/B testable program variables, you can enable variations of your app for randomized segments of your user audience.
segment.target: By building app logic around A/B testable program variables, you can enable variations of your app for randomized segments of your user audience.

segment.source: The goal of your A/B test is to identify a variation that is likely to earn you improved conversion rates (for example, more in-app purchases).
segment.target: The goal of your A/B test is to identify a variation that is likely to earn you improved conversion rates (for example, more in-app purchases).

segment.source: After you have identified a variation that best meets your business goals, you can immediately end the experiment and enable that variation for your entire user audience from the Dev Center dashboard, without having to republish your app.
segment.target: After you have identified a variation that best meets your business goals, you can immediately end the experiment and enable that variation for your entire user audience from the Dev Center dashboard, without having to republish your app.

segment.source: Create and run an A/B test
segment.target: Create and run an A/B test

segment.source: To create and run an A/B test, follow these steps:
segment.target: To create and run an A/B test, follow these steps:

segment.source: Define your experiment in the Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: Define your experiment in the Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: Each experiment consists of:
segment.target: Each experiment consists of:

segment.source: A view event that indicates when the user starts viewing a variation that is part of your experiment.
segment.target: A view event that indicates when the user starts viewing a variation that is part of your experiment.

segment.source: One or more goals with conversion events that indicate when an objective has been reached.
segment.target: One or more goals with conversion events that indicate when an objective has been reached.

segment.source: One or more variations that define the settings used by your experiment.
segment.target: One or more variations that define the settings used by your experiment.

segment.source: Code your app for experimentation.
segment.target: Code your app for experimentation.

segment.source: Use an API in the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK to get variation settings for the experiment, use this data to modify the behavior of the feature you are testing, and send view event and conversion events to Dev Center.
segment.target: Use an API in the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK to get variation settings for the experiment, use this data to modify the behavior of the feature you are testing, and send view event and conversion events to Dev Center.

segment.source: Run and manage your experiment in the Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: Run and manage your experiment in the Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: Use the dashboard to review the results of the experiment and complete the experiment.
segment.target: Use the dashboard to review the results of the experiment and complete the experiment.

segment.source: For a walkthrough that demonstrates the end-to-end process, see Create and run your first experiment with A/B testing.
segment.target: For a walkthrough that demonstrates the end-to-end process, see Create and run your first experiment with A/B testing.

segment.source: Requirements
segment.target: Requirements

segment.source: A/B testing in Windows Dev Center is supported only for UWP apps.
segment.target: A/B testing in Windows Dev Center is supported only for UWP apps.

segment.source: Before you can run experiments with A/B testing, you must set up your development computer:
segment.target: Before you can run experiments with A/B testing, you must set up your development computer:

segment.source: Follow the instructions here to set up your development computer for UWP development.
segment.target: Follow the instructions here to set up your development computer for UWP development.

segment.source: Install the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.
segment.target: Install the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.

segment.source: In addition to the API for experiments, this SDK also provides APIs for other features such as displaying ads and directing your customers to Feedback Hub to collect feedback on your app.
segment.target: In addition to the API for experiments, this SDK also provides APIs for other features such as displaying ads and directing your customers to Feedback Hub to collect feedback on your app.

segment.source: For more information about this SDK, see Monetize your app with the Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.
segment.target: For more information about this SDK, see Monetize your app with the Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.

segment.source: Best practices
segment.target: Best practices

segment.source: For the most useful results, we recommend that you follow these recommendations when running experiments with A/B testing:
segment.target: For the most useful results, we recommend that you follow these recommendations when running experiments with A/B testing:

segment.source: Consider running experiments with only two variations with a randomized 50/50 split distribution for variation assignments.
segment.target: Consider running experiments with only two variations with a randomized 50/50 split distribution for variation assignments.

segment.source: Run experiments for at least 2 – 4 weeks to gather sufficient data that is statistically significant and actionable.
segment.target: Run experiments for at least 2 – 4 weeks to gather sufficient data that is statistically significant and actionable.
